node.title: Nerves and celebration as Katherine exits lockout amid COVID-19 concerns
node.alt: A woman wearing an orange top smiles at the camera
node.description: After three weeks of COVID-19 restrictions, 63 cases and the tragic passing of an Aboriginal elder from the nearby remote community of Binjari, Katherine is now open for business.
node.content:
["After three weeks of\u00a0COVID-19 restrictions, 63\u00a0cases and the tragic passing of an Aboriginal elder from\u00a0the nearby remote community of Binjari,\u00a0Katherine is\u00a0now open for business.\u00a0", "\"Today is a celebration,\" said Anna Berry, who opened\u00a0her cafe, Anna's Cafe, just\u00a0three months before COVID-19 hit the regional town.", "\"For three weeks, we would've lost $60,000 alone [on sales], and that's not counting my staff.", "\"But today, I am very happy. I can't sit in the corner and cry about the spilt milk. I've spent the money \u2014 now I've got to recover it somehow.\"", "Ms Berry \u2014\u00a0who was born in Vanuatu \u2014\u00a0said she started her cafe to\u00a0serve Pacific Island food\u00a0to seasonal workers who had come to Katherine to pick mangoes.\u00a0", "Now\u00a0she's ready to start welcoming customers for seated service again after the Katherine region\u00a0left\u00a0the Northern Territory's longest period of lockdown and lockout at\u00a012pm on Wednesday.", "A mask mandate will remain in place for the next week.", "Katherine was put into lockdown on November 15 after exiting one just a week before.", "The move has been welcomed by a town that has done it\u00a0tough from the beginning of November when this latest outbreak began.", "Aboriginal health service Wurli-Wurlinjang's primary healthcare operations manager, Antony King, said people in Katherine were \"a bit nervous\".\u00a0", "\"Obviously, with some positive wastewater, there potentially could be cases [in the community],\" he said.\u00a0", "\"But we need to get used to this.\"\u00a0", "From December 20, double-vaccinated travellers from interstate red zones such as\u00a0Melbourne will no longer need to quarantine when they enter the Northern Territory.\u00a0", "On Wednesday, the Northern Territory's\u00a0Acting Chief Health Officer, Charles Pain, said Katherine's double-dose vaccination rate had now surpassed 80 per cent, according to NT government figures.", "However, Dr Pain said, there had\u00a0been ongoing debate over the NT government's calculations.", "Mr King said that, although vaccination rates had been \"rising steadily\" in Katherine, he believed the town still had further to go.", "It's a concern shared by\u00a0Katherine resident Max Morris, who said he was worried about\u00a0some of his friends and family members who have chosen to remain unvaccinated.", "\"It's very scary,\" he said.\u00a0\"You hear about the deaths every day and then\u00a0you hear your friends say, 'Oh I don't want to get vaccinated' and that's when the fear kicks in for [their welfare].\"", "", "
Max\u00a0Morris says\u00a0he is nervous for unvaccinated Katherine residents.(ABC News: Hamish Harty)
", "Mr Morris\u00a0said\u00a0lifting\u00a0lockout was \"a little bit premature\", given the new Omicron variant of concern had arrived in Australia, and evidence of COVID-19\u00a0was still present in Katherine.\u00a0", "Other residents have welcomed\u00a0the easing of restrictions.\u00a0", "Katherine father Isuro Perera said he was \"really happy\" the lockout had finally lifted because it allowed\u00a0him to\u00a0see his wife and two-year-old daughter, who live in Barunga, for the first time in a month.", "\"It's been really hard,\" he said of the lockdown period.\u00a0", "\"I\u00a0was isolated in a room and I\u00a0had to cook, myself, so that was\u00a0really hard for me.\"", "When he heard the news that restrictions were easing, Mr Perera\u00a0said he went straight\u00a0to Katherine Woolworths to buy some toys for his daughter.\u00a0", "", "
Isuro Perera says\u00a0he can't\u00a0wait to be reunited with his wife and daughter.(ABC News: Hamish Harty\u00a0)
"]
